Sentencas: A two-dimensional mechanistic model of a tubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) considering momentum, energy, mass and charge transport is developed.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The model geometry of a single cell comprises an air-preheating tube, air channel, fuel channel, anode, cathode and electrolyte layers.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The heat radiation between cell and air-preheating tube is also incorporated into the model.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This allows the model to predict heat transfer between the cell and air-preheating tube accurately.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The model is validated and shows good agreement with literature data.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: It is anticipated that this model can be used to help develop efficient fuel cell designs and set operating variables under practical conditions.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The transport phenomena inside the cell, including gas flow behaviour, temperature, overpotential, current density and species concentration, are analysed and discussed in detail.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Fuel and air velocities are found to vary along flow passages depending on the local temperature and species concentrations.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: This model demonstrates the importance of incorporating heat radiation into a tubular SOFC model.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Furthermore, the model shows that the overall cell performance is limited by O-2 diffusion through the thick porous cathode and points to the development of new cathode materials and designs being important avenues to enhance cell performance.
Titulo: Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell
Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell
Mechanistic modelling of a cathode-supported tubular solid oxide fuel cell
